meanings.definition: To make something more appealing to yuppies.
meanings.sent1: She decided to yuppify her apartment by adding trendy decor and modern furniture.
meanings.sent2: The new cafe in town aims to yuppify the neighborhood with its artisanal coffee and avocado toast.
meanings.sent3: The old bookstore tried to yuppify itself by hosting a book club for young professionals.
meanings.sent4: The small town was yuppified overnight when a hipster coffee shop opened on Main Street.
meanings.sent5: The marketing team's goal was to yuppify the brand image to attract a younger audience.

meanings.definition: To adopt the lifestyle or values associated with yuppies.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the city, he started to yuppify his wardrobe with designer labels and tailored suits.
meanings.sent2: She began to yuppify her social media presence by posting about luxury vacations and upscale restaurants.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to yuppify his camping trip with a gourmet picnic ended in a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: The small town girl yuppified her speech to fit in with the urban crowd, but it sounded forced.
meanings.sent5: The suburban neighborhood slowly yuppified as more young professionals moved in and opened trendy cafes.
